item.title: [video] Google Voice Search (at Forbes.com)
Yahoo Layoffs Set for December 10 (And, No, Jerry Yang Is Not Leaving Too) (at AllThingsD)
item.description: While they're not as significant as the potentially 6,000 layoffs at Sun Microsystems, several sources at Yahoo said that the previously announced layoffs at the Internet giant are set to take effect on December 10.

item.title: Final Glance: Internet companies (AP)
Citigroup slashing jobs, raising card rates: report (at MarketWatch)
item.description: Citigroup has begun big layoffs and is expected to cut at least 10,000 jobs around the globe, a published report said Friday.

item.title: 4 Companies Putting Money in Buybacks (at Motley Fool)
Student's trial delayed in Palin hacking case (AP)
item.description: The complexity of a computer crime trumped the need for a speedy trial Friday in the case of the son of a Democratic Tennessee state lawmaker charged with breaking into the e-mail account of former Republican vice presidential candidate Sarah Palin.

item.title: Google $300, Yahoo! $10 (at Motley Fool)
Google Late To Game With Voice-Activated Search On Mobile (paidContent.org)
item.description: Google is planning to launch a new version of search on the iPhone that will allow users to conduct searches by using their voice, and asking questions, such as "Where's the nearest Starbucks?" or "How tall is Mount Everest?"

item.title: Small Businesses Find Ways to Survive (at TheStreet.com)

What Color is 51job's Parachute? (at Motley Fool)
item.description: Chinese job classifieds specialist 51job struggles for answers.

item.title: Kara Visits AdMob (and Talks About How iPhone Turbocharged the Mobile Advertising Business) (at AllThingsD)

YAHOO INC Financials (EDGAR Online Financials)
Invest Like It's 1998: Microsoft Stock Hits 10-Year Low, Down 30 Percent From First Yahoo Offer (paidContent.org)
item.description: Microsoft stock hit its lowest point in 10 years on Thursdayâ $18.74âwhen the tech sector took hits from Cisco and Intel , before coming back to close at $21.25. Meantime, Google enjoyed something of a reboundârelatively speakingâending above $300 Thursday after hitting a three-year low the day before.

item.title: AMD makeover moves show limited choices in slump (AP)
item.description: Many of the problems facing Advanced Micro Devices Inc. are of its own making. But the limited choices the chip maker has for solving its troubles are symptoms of an affliction sweeping through Silicon Valley.

item.title: Yahoo: Where's Icahn as Stock Dips Below $10? (at Seeking Alpha)

Ad Industry Roundup: NYT; Yahoo; Behavioral Targeting; Ad-Skipping; Meredith (paidContent.org)
item.description: -- NYT And Monster partner on free job posting promo: With help wanted ads continuing to decline, newspapers might as well give the space away. Well, that's what NYT and partner Monster.com are doingâas long as recruiters get their job listings in by midnight on Thursday.

item.title: What Is Apple Searching For? (at Motley Fool)
